block.p: Melissa Lynn Winstanley, the daughter of Barbara and David Winstanley of Concord, Mass., was married yesterday to Matthew Bradley McCreedy, a son of Linda and Edwin McCreedy of Colts Neck, N.J. The Very Rev. Martin Luther Agnew performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Ann's Church in Kennebunkport, Me.

Mrs. McCreedy, 24, teaches English. Until last month she taught at St. George's School in Newport, R.I., and in September she will teach at the Middlesex School in Concord. She will also coach field hockey and lacrosse at Middlesex, from which she and the bridegroom graduated. They went to their senior prom together in 1994, but then were at different colleges. They met again in 1999 at their Middlesex fifth reunion.

Melissa Lynn Winstanley, the daughter of Barbara and David Winstanley of Concord, Mass., was married yesterday to Matthew Bradley McCreedy, a son of Linda and Edwin McCreedy of Colts Neck, N.J. The Very Rev. Martin Luther Agnew performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Ann's Church in Kennebunkport, Me.

Mrs. McCreedy, 24, teaches English. Until last month she taught at St. George's School in Newport, R.I., and in September she will teach at the Middlesex School in Concord. She will also coach field hockey and lacrosse at Middlesex, from which she and the bridegroom graduated. They went to their senior prom together in 1994, but then were at different colleges. They met again in 1999 at their Middlesex fifth reunion.

The bride received a bachelor's degree from Williams College. Her father is a partner in Winstanley Enterprises, a real estate investment and development company in Concord. Her mother is a watercolorist.

Mr. McCreedy, 25, is a trader on the Boston Stock Exchange for Ward, Conary & Murphy, a Boston brokerage firm. He graduated from Connecticut College. His mother is a real estate broker at Showcase Realty in Colts Neck. His father is a partner in McCreedy & Cox, a law firm in Cranford, N.J.
